definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: Painters were hired to try and blend the huge, obtrusive towers into the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 受僱的畫家嘗試着將突兀的巨塔融入周圍的風景之中。

sentences.english: The men were employed to look after Masoud's tomb.
sentences.chinese: 這些人受僱照看馬蘇德的墳墓。

sentences.english: So, that is the story of how I came to rejoin the ranks of the employed.
sentences.chinese: 以上就是關於我怎樣再一次加入到受僱者行列的故事。

sentences.english: He usually is a very loyal employee but occasionally he lies down on the job.
sentences.chinese: 他通常是一位很忠實的受僱者，但偶爾也會玩忽職守。

sentences.english: This Regulation shall apply to every seafarer employed under a crew agreement.
sentences.chinese: 本規例適用於每一名根據船員協議受僱的海員。

sentences.english: Crooks-for-hire will infect a thousand computers for $7.
sentences.chinese: 受僱的壞蛋只給7美元就可以感染1000臺電腦。

sentences.english: Keys: 1. He's employed on house repairs.
sentences.chinese: 他受僱從事房屋維修工作。

sentences.english: The brave colleague punched the attacker in the mawayh.
sentences.chinese: 這個勇士一記重拳打在受僱的嘴巴上。

sentences.english: Large  numbers of unskilled workers are employed at the lowest rates of pay.
sentences.chinese: 大量不熟練工人以最低的工資受僱。

sentences.english: And they're actually paid to scare you.
sentences.chinese: 事實上他們是受僱嚇唬你的。

sentences.english: and Bernays was employed to promote America's war aims in the press.
sentences.chinese: 伯奈斯受僱來宣傳這場美國的戰爭在報紙上的目的。

sentences.english: I got hired one summer to sack grain.
sentences.chinese: 有一年夏季，我受僱替人把糧食裝袋。

sentences.english: Already non-native speaking English teachers are deemed to be more employable in some Asian countries.
sentences.chinese: 已非母語的英語教師被認爲是更受僱在一些亞洲國家。

sentences.english: In Waiau there are farmers employed full time for rabbit eradication.
sentences.chinese: 在懷奧河地區，有些農民受僱專職消滅野兔。

sentences.english: These employees are essentially short, the freedom of movement.
sentences.chinese: 這些受僱者，基本上都是短工。

sentences.english: The agreement inures to the benefit of the employment .
sentences.chinese: 那協定對於受僱的人們有助益。

definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
